skill.author: Dwsy

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation management skill using Node.js fs APIs. Only reads/writes markdown files to local docs/ directory. No network calls, no external commands, no sensitive data access. All 303 static findings are false positives from misclassified markdown examples and path strings.

content.value_statement: Managing project documentation across multiple files and tracking issues becomes disorganized. Workhub enforces a Single Source of Truth principle with standardized templates for architecture decisions, issues, and pull requests in a structured docs/ directory.
actual_capabilities: Initialize standardized docs/ directory structure with adr/, architecture/, issues/, pr/ folders
Create issue files from templates with status tracking and acceptance criteria
Create pull request files from templates with rollback plans
List all issues and PRs with their current status
Search across all issues and PRs for specific keywords
Audit docs structure for compliance with SSOT governance rules
limitations: Only manages markdown files in the local docs/ directory
Does not integrate with external issue trackers like GitHub Issues
No built-in synchronization or backup capabilities
Status updates require manual file editing

use_cases.title: Architecture Decision Records
use_cases.description: Document architectural decisions with context, alternatives considered, and trade-offs made.

use_cases.title: Task Tracking and Planning
use_cases.description: Track implementation phases, acceptance criteria, and status of features and bug fixes.

use_cases.title: Pull Request Documentation
use_cases.description: Document changes with rollback plans, risk assessments, and test verification results.

prompt_templates.title: Create Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Use workhub to create an issue titled "[description]" in the [category] category. Then show me the created file path.

prompt_templates.title: Track Progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Run workhub status to show me all open issues and their current phase progress.

prompt_templates.title: Review Changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Run workhub list prs to show pending PRs, then read the PR file for [PR name] to review the rollback plan.

prompt_templates.title: Find Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Search workhub for "[keyword]" to find relevant issues and PRs related to this feature.

output_examples.input: Create an issue for adding dark mode to the UI
output: Edit the file and fill in Goal, Phases, Acceptance Criteria
Each shows title and file path

best_practices: Initialize docs structure before starting any project work
Create an issue before starting any feature or bug fix
Update issue status as you complete each phase
anti_patterns: Using the wrong directory path when reading or creating files
Skipping the issue template when creating new tasks
Not linking PRs to their related issues

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Workhub works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Run commands using bun path/to/lib.ts command.

faq.question: What directory structure does it create?
faq.answer: It creates docs/ with subdirectories: adr/, architecture/, issues/, and pr/ for organized documentation.

faq.question: Can I organize issues by module?
faq.answer: Yes, create issues in subdirectories like docs/issues/frontend/ by specifying a category parameter.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only accesses the local docs/ directory. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why is my file not found?
faq.answer: Run workhub from your project root where docs/ exists. Use relative paths from docs/ when reading.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Issues?
faq.answer: Workhub stores issues locally as markdown files following SSOT principle without external service integration.
